content: In doing some research on how my ballot had mistakes in it.. I did find an issue. I am not done looking at my whole ballot.. Here is the issue GF16585 was entered by me based on some workgroup discussions. However I did not include this in my infrastructure ballot. But it appears someone else did include it in a negative ballot... THUS I fear my valid gForge item is going to get thrown away because someone else did bad ballot submission.
that was a typo by that other person and I thought we were going to correct that typo

okay... I do find a few other items that I very clearly messed up and put them into the infrastructure, when I should have put them into stu... sorry, but the interface for ballot when one records the comment in gForge is not optimal.
so I would conclude that my type of mistake will be better with better tool
can I withdraw my ballot negative on those mistakes I made? Would that keep them alive for the intended reason?
@Lloyd McKenzie ?
aka... can I ask to have my ballot negatives on those mistakes be "Forgotten"... :-)
but process wise the easiest thing to do is for you to clone them
but I have EU given rights given that I am this week in the EU...
hah
how does one clone a gForge item?
GF#14192 is an example... It has a long history of workgroup discussion that should not be lost due to this most recent ballot mistake
reenter manually, as far as I know
If you retract the negative, then it gets dispositioned as Resolved, no change. Retraction of a negative can only happen once there's a resolution.
There is actually a "clone" option in gForge. Edit the item and select "Clone item"
(And obviously remove the ballot strength and ballot from the cloned item)
Not sure what happens to comments when you do that.
I don't see any way to clone.
Maybe it's an admin function. Tell me what you need cloned and I can do it.
Can we re-categorize a ballot issue from correction to typo?
Yes
And you can auto-approve it once re-categorized.
Occasionally we recategegorize the reverse way
What you can't do is turn a negative into a typo and find it anything other than persuasive
